Column Comment.0: PARCEL_LOT: unique identifier for the parcel lot. If desired, may be populated withthe ID of the land parcel to be described, although the appropriate FK column shouldalso be populated.
Column Comment.1: PARCEL LOT TYPE: the type of parcel lot descibed. Used to describe the type of USland parcel lots, in the congressional legal survey system.
Column Comment.2: LOT NUM: An alpha numeric identifier assigned to the lot, possibly by a municipalityor county.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: GROSS SIZE: Total amount of land measured in hectares/acres in the land rightbase on working interest
Column Comment.7: GROSS SIZE OUOM: Usually hectares or acres
Column Comment.8: LOT DESCRIPTION: Textual description of the lot; usually formatted as metes andbounds
Column Comment.9: LOT NAME: Name assigned to the lot.
Column Comment.10: LAND PARCELCONGRESS: Unique identifier for the Congress land parcel
Column Comment.11: LAND PARCEL OHIO: Unique identifier for the Ohio land parcel
Column Comment.12: LAND PARCEL PUBLIC LAND BLOCK: Unique identifier for the land parcel in termsof the public land block system of Alberta, Canada
Column Comment.13: LAND PARCELTEXAS: Unique identifier for the Texas land parcel
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: REMARK TYPE: Entries in this column describe the general topic of the remark, sothat remarks can be grouped by subject area. Topics might include royaltycomments, well comments, deficiencies, rental billing comments, etc.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.NOTE: In this table, the FK is added to allow you to describe the polygonal outline fora parcel.
Column Comment.19: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
